intro: Acetosella chinensis, commonly known as Chinese spring beauty, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its rosette of hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to China, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a desirable ornamental plant in gardens and conservation efforts.
